Reviews.Title: “Low price - clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: PinkertonWatts
Reviews.Content: When I visit Vegas I'm always looking for a deal on hotel rooms. I've stayed in most of the strip hotels, from New York New York to MGM to Venetian/Palazzo, and I love them all. However, a lot of times you need to save cash to spend on the casino floor, and Casino Royale is the place to do it. No, its not the the flashiest place for sure. The rooms are fairly standard...maybe on the small side, but everything is extremely clean (and in fact, pretty new). It has a great location, a fridge, and a coffee maker. The rooms aren't anything special, but they aren't bad at all - they have a comfy bed, nice, big flatscreen TV and a table/chairs. The beds are really comfy, and the bathroom, while basic, is clean and functional as well. Lots of reviews say that they have found it to be expensive here. When I stayed here, Venetian/Palazzo was over $200, Luxor was $180, Excalibur was $160, and good old Casino Royale was $69. For $69 per night this place is a huge value. The casino is fun, and most other places are within easy walking distance (right next door to Harrah's). Also, right between the Palazzo and Venetian is a Walgreens that is within easy walking distance to grab items you need without the inflated Vegas prices. The tables are cheap, craps tables are rowdy (in a good way) and they allow you to bet up to 100x your odds bet. $1 Michelobs (though I have to say one of the ones I was given in 2010 had a born on date from 1996?!?!?) are awesome. Really for a great value on the strip in Vegas, this place is awesome. I can't overstate how while many other older strip hotels can be very dirty, this place was spotless. -PW

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: NewhavenOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in April 2012. After parking our car behind the casino we followed the sign to the front desk which is located at the front of Casino and not really easy to find. You have to dodge slot players and smokers, (the two seem to go hand in hand and Las Vegas still allows smoking in it's casinos, gag), to get to the front desk. After checking in you have another trip through the casino till you find the door to the rooms. The room itself seemed fine other than a silverfish I caught after finding it between our sheets. All in all I would never stay here again. It's back to the Mirage or similar size hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with reservation personnel”
Reviews.Author: RTT383
Reviews.Content: Hello, My wife and I stayed recently at CR. I am writing this review to pass along an incident which occurred to us in the making of the reservation. We had been to Vegas in fall of 2011 and I had played table games at CR using their players card while staying at a nearby hotel. In December we talked of a spring visit to Vegas so I thought of using any comps I may have earned in the fall. I contacted CR on their 800 number explaining what I wanted to do. The "customer service rep" checked on my previous play supposedly, I might add, and told me that based on that I would qualify for 3 or maybe 4 free nights. He went on to say that I should make the reservation, paying for 1 night and that comps for that period would automatically be applied once March arrived. Fastforward to March and I called back on the 31st to check on the comps and was told they hadn't been applied yet. Obviously now that was huge signal. At that point our reservation was less than a week away. Any flexibility was limited so I decided to wait until checking in to straighten things out. I didn't write down the name of who I spoke with but I'm fairly certain who he was. At checkin we were told we had no free nights and after some arguing I was told to contact a pit boss to see what he could do. I explained to him the whole set of details and he simply said that they made no sense to him and that my play would not qualify for comped nights.......quite a different story than what the phone rep had said. In the end we both received monetary comps we could apply to the reservation; however, I only made the reservation based on what phone rep. told me. In a nutshell, I was blatantly lied to in order for me to commit to a reservation. I get a feeling that this has happened before. Make no mistake, in the future when making reservations I will consider CR but you can BET I will do some documentation. As far as, the phone rep and the pit boss...I would love to see them along the strip selling bottles of water or slapping cards......because we will have another conversation. I am rating in poor because of the blatant lie...otherwise it's a 3 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Seems like a good value”
Reviews.Author: Dominic L
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for a wedding and considered the Imperial Palace. However after reading reviews decided to stay here instead. We were really glad we did after a friend stayed at Imperial Palace and said it was very dirty. The Casino Royale had very nice rooms with coffee and a refrigerator. We choose the lowest price which didn't have a great view but was comfortable and clean. They were even able to put family members down the hall from us even though they registered weeks after we did. They also allowed us to stay in the parking garage until the wedding was over even though we had already checked out that morning. We enjoyed the several food options in the same building as well as the low price bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not A bad Place”
Reviews.Author: rgo711
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick weekend get away, Not bad, not bad at all ! Rooms were priced very reasonable, clean, quite and right in the middle of all the action on the strip. Pool was closed but it was chilly out ( March) , Looked like a nice pool tho kinda small. Finding the hotel front desk was a little difficult , All said il would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Casino Royale for Gamblers & Drinkers...thank you very much!”
Reviews.Author: Psychobillyband
Reviews.Content: With everything on the Vegas Strip seeming to become one giant shopping mall it's nice to have at least one place centrally located on the strip that offers what Vegas is all about....Gambling and Drinking. I've never stayed in the hotel, but, have spent many hours playing at Casino Royale. Their bar offers $1 tourist drink specials to get you in the door. Usually some smallish frozen drink or a 12 oz. domestic beer (Michelob?). But, that's not all the bar/casino offers. It's a great place to play some video poker while tossing back some well priced drinks. You can buy 4 drinks at Casino Royale for less then the price of one drink at other strip casino bars and I'm not talking about the $1 specials. The wait staff are fast & friendly. The bartendars are GREAT. Darrell, one of the bartendars, always seems to be there when the wife and I visit. He is GREAT! Offering fantastic service and great conversation in regard to all the latest sporting events & life in general. He and his fellow staff members really make you feel welcome. Tips seem to be greatly appreciated and are well deserved. Tip well and you will treated like a king at Casino Royale. True, Casino Royale may not be for everyone. There's no marbled atriums, circus acts, giant buffets or volcano....but, all of those things are VERY CLOSE to Casino Royale. Casino Royale sets in the center of the strip near Imperial Palace, Harrah's, Venetian and Ceasar's Palace. It's a great spot to get your Vegas evening started with some drinks and gaming. The casino offers good slot play and pretty good video poker. There are several BJ tables and Craps as well. The folks at the table games always seem to be loud and in a party mood!! It's a great atmosphere that caters to 'normal' folks. There is a 'Tix Tonight' is the casino offering discount show/dining tickets as well as several fast food type restaurants. A Denny's is next door as well. If you can't have a good time at Casino Royale, you probably are a very boring person.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Joey510
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casino Royle for a few nights, the location of the hotel was fabulous you don't need a car to get anywhere, perfect location. The hotel rooms were very quiet and harldy heard anything in the hallway. This hotel also has a pool that was very clean. The room we stayed in had a fridge and microwave which was also great. I would strongly recommend this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If you are planning on visiting Vegas check out Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Charlesy P
Reviews.Content: Location of this casino and hotel are perfect for being in the middle of everything at a discounted price. Rooms are steps from strip. They are clean, neat and front desk is very helpful. The comp system at the casino makes it easy to earn free food. They explain that to you when you sign up for players card. If you like to drink they have specials that are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: maxpaste
Reviews.Content: Pros: great price ($49/room), great location, and very clean. Cons: location of hotel check-in and room access not so obvious, no wireless available (although there is a business center). My biggest complaint was the window of my room on the 'even' (right) side of the floor overlooked what appeared to be a major recycling station next door. There was a large dumpster, and bottles were being sorted and emptied at all hours. Imagine your weekly recyclables being picked-up and dumped in the truck, and quadruple that sound all night. I'm not too picky about sounds, but the sounds of clanging bottles woke me several times each night. I would recommend getting a room on the 'odd' side (i.e. left) of the facility to minimize this sound. Another tip: they don't have a taxi area, so they will either call a taxi for you, or you can walk over to Harrahs next door and hire one of the many that are always waiting there. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to be in a good spot on the strip but not paying a lot per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travel....”
Reviews.Author: jeff b
Reviews.Content: Ended up here for a conference at the Venetian (fully booked)... This is probably a great place if you are looking for a cheap room to crash in while your completely drunk. Otherwise, there isn't any internet connection or wifi in the rooms, no ironing board or iron... In the grand scheme of things it wasn't really clean (carpets turned my socks black)... And it was really noisy (every door opening and closing sounds like its next to your head...) So if you're looking for a place to crash while drunk, its probably fine. If you will spend zero time in your room and are just using it to store you bags... might be ok (i would put the do not disturb on the door....) if you want more than that, then you will have to pay more than $60 a night :) again, not my first choice, and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrunkMonkey64
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for the Shot Show last month and had a great time. Rooms were great and easy to get too. No walking all the way through a casino just to get to the elevator. The rooms where much bigger then I expected and everything was kept very clean. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Adventure”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Happy
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised by this gem of a hotel and casino. My girlfriend and her parents have been staying here for years and I can see why. The craps pay 100x odds and always have people playing on them. The drinks just keep coming and if you are out of gambling money, they are cheap from the bar. They also have BJ Switch which is very addicting. There is a Denny's next door as well as Hot Dogs, Pizza, and Cinnabon inside. There is an Outback Steakhouse upstairs. There is not sports book, but because it is so wonderfully centrally located on the strip, you just go next door to Harrah's or Imperial and you are covered. The rooms have fridge's and flat screen t.v.'s to occupy your time while you are changing clothes. I would most definitely stay here the next time I am Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Casino Royal is a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Will B
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Casino Royal during the month of January for the SHOT show trade show. My time at the hotel was great and could not have asked for any better accommodations. The employees at the hotel where very curious and helpful. The rooms where spacious and very comfortable. Fresh linens where placed on the beds and fresh towels placed in the bathroom daily and the room kept very clean. The hotel is in a perfect location on the strip which is in the center and only a few minutes walk to all the main tourist and casinos available. I highly recommend the hotel and will give them return business in the future. The prices are very reasonable and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Super Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SangSom
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that the Casino Royal exceeded our expectations. It was centrally located, as we were able to go next door to both Harrah’s, to place our sports bets, and to spend a day at the Canyon Ranch Spa at the Venetian. Plus, hubby could play craps all night because of the generous tables. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Question: Would I stay at the Casino Royale again? Answer: Is the hotel’s namesake a James Bond Movie? Oh yeah--there is a Subway's onsite and a Denny's connected to it. Last year, we stayed at Aria and it was just too big and too commercial.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Friendliest Hotel Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erica M
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I had never been to Vegas before and we had heard really great things about this hotel and the awesome rates, so we decided to stay there. We were kinda lost when we got there but the staff was super friendly and showed us our way around the hotel. We were also impressed on the location it is in the middle of the strip and close to everything which was a big plus! Our room was super clean and the bed was super comfy after a long day of walking it was nice to relax because even the hotel was on the Strip our room was super quiet it was so nice! We were wondering about what to do and came across the Operations manager he was so helpful on helping find our way around vegas and also on all the great hotel ammendities it was such a great experiance we will definatley be recommending the casino royale, because we absolutely enjoyed our stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of all the great ratings it has on this website, and also the price!! There is an amzing bar there where drinks are cheap and they keep em coming! I will most definately be staying there again. The operations manager noticed we looked a little lost and helped us to what we were looking for. This is the friendliest staff I have ever come into contact with. Dealers were very patient with me as I have never played craps before! Love, Love, Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds and Great Location! Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: FastMazz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer during my WSOP run, and found the bed to be very comfortable. The room is on the small side though. Shower had good pressure, and did provide soap/shapoo and a hairdryer was in the unit. It also had a flat screen TV, table and chairs, but no sofa. I have no complaints about it as I don't spend a lot of time in the room as I'm only using it when I'm sleeping, and my view was that of the alley. What I really liked about it is that its in between the Venetian/Treasure Island and Flamingo hotel, it's location cannot be beat for this price. There's no fees at this hotel. Food and beer is cheap, and right next to Denny's. I'd reccomend this to the traveler on a tight budget because the room prices are very low compared to the other hotels around it. You won't get this hotel on Expedia or Orbitz, so you will have to go to their website to book the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay,”
Reviews.Author: JG727
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a trade show. The Casino Royale has very clean rooms that appear to be recently remodeled. It's centrally located, the staff is friendly, and you CANNOT beat the price. I will definitely be staying here again next year. The only potential downside is that depending on where your room is it can be a chore to get to the parking garage. We didn't have this problem, and other memebers of my party told me that it is much worse at other hotels/casinos. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great scene for craps”
Reviews.Author: Ebazinam
Reviews.Content: Craps can't be beat on the strip. 100 and 200x odds. Friendly dealers, great location and 1 beer and margaritas. It is quite smokey in here, but there is enough good qualities to overlook this trivial issue.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: troy46
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Vegas for the SHOT SHOW. We rented 27 rooms at Casino Royale and we all enjoyed the hotel and casino. It's a great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LVNV99
Reviews.Content: Great Location, modern large rooms with fantastic beds. The hotel is very clean & with the friendliest staff around. Management is fantastic which gives you the confident feeling that if an issue arises, your needs will be taken care of. Casino is always packed & full of excitement. I would stay here again & would highly recommend this property. Thank you for a great stay Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jonnyoftheboy
Reviews.Content: Have done Vegas numerous times now, stayed at the glitzier hotels. to be honest, if you want the glitz of Vegas.... this is not your hotel. if you want good old fashioned value for money....with an excellent location..... then here it is! table minimums low on the casino games. rooms are clean and functional, showers decent. drinks at the bar FAR cheaper than the bigger glitzier hotels ($10 for a round of 4 vs $35 for same round at Ceasars!) staff friendly..... especially if you engage with them. have stayed twice now, and will be the hotel of choice. great hotel for those who want an active trip to Vegas. as I say, not much glitz..... but suits me!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: J E
Reviews.Content: My husband had always wanted to stay at this hotel in Vegas. I finally relented and had an awesome experience. The location is great! The rooms were very large, comfortable and clean. It takes a room key to even enter the hotel (which is not the casino). We would stay there again in a heartbeat. The front desk staff was good. They didn't "kiss butt" like many of the big resorts, but they did their job with a smile on their faces. Consider what you are paying for and realize that is what you're going to get plus some.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, location -- would return!”
Reviews.Author: msquared99
Reviews.Content: Nope, it's very far from flashy -- but the front desk was gracious and efficient, the room was simple and adequate, and the TV worked -- not that you should spend time glued to a TV in Vegas. This is not a spa place, just a convenient location from which to explore. Our Casino Royale window looked out on the beautiful St. Marco tower of the Venetian -- spectacular! It's only a 3 minute walk away. For the price and location, would certainly stay here again rather than in a 2,000 room space station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: SRAV_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in Las Vegas, early Nov'2011. The deals from other hotels on the strip were for 3 nights or more, so we had to chose Casino Royale for the location and money value ($130 for a night). Overall, liked its location, 15 min walk to Bellagio and just adjacent to Venetian, with multiple food chains a step away. Great place if u want to take in Night experience of the main strip, without too much walking..The room was simple, nothing fancy..but comfortable, most importantly bathroom was very clean. Equipped with Coffee maker, Fridge and TV. We got a room facing the pool, so it was a quiet and scenic view. Thanks for the previous posters on Trip Advisor for their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “You Have to be kidding me!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: I treavel with my wife there from the 18-23 october 2011. It started in the Parking garage and got worse. You get to walk right by the dumpsters... Which smells like CRAP!! The hallway smelled like PEE.... When we got to the room the TV was new but never got a channel you could watch though all the snow on every channel... The view SUCKS!! as in NONE!! Never had Hot water I guess we stayed to close to the laundry.. The only exit to your rooms were though the same door they haul the trash away. Just a bad $49 one nighter!! So we left and went to the Venetian.. Thats where her conferance was anyway... If you dont believe me just walk by and see for yourself. The only thing I found good about it... Dollar Mic Lites and Lagers. Yep that was the only thing good. Dont take my word for it.. Please see for yourself. Have a great day

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the casino”
Reviews.Author: Chris Duc
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel so I cannot comment on it or the restaurants. I did however get a $100.00 free coupon to use on the slot machines and then a $50.00 coupon to do the same thing. A TOTAL RIP-OFF. For those who have never tried slot machines in Vegas, this is how they (should) work. You feed in your money; say $10.00 to whatever machine you like. Then you play and at any time, if you still have money remaining, you can "cash out" and get a ticket to be redeemed at the cashier for your money. Also, if you win ANY amount of money, you can also cash out and go and get your money. NOT at the Casino Royale IF YOU are using their "$50.00 in free slot play". You MUST use the machines that they tell you and there are only about 12 - 15 of them and they are ALL $1.00 machines. You CANNOT "cash out" OR even take any amount that you might win UNLESS you win a Jackpot (NOT very likely)! These machines are disgusting too; very dirty since everyone plays them! Yuck. The woman next to me had "WON" $146.00 but could not take the money!! Her only option was to keep playing until the money was all gone. A total scam. We were so annoyed that we refused to put even $1.00 into any of there other machines and we left.

Reviews.Title: “Looney Locals”
Reviews.Author: travelteacher
Reviews.Content: Love to gamble and drink here because the table limits are low and the beer is cheap. This trip my son joined us and was driven from the casino by looney locals. He went to the bar for drinks was approached by LV locals accusing him of being a cop or a narc. He's got a good build and a short haircut. They surrounded him and started shoving. He broke away with no help from the staff and we left immediately. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “no smiles!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: samMplsMn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself were EXTREMELY dissapointed with the staff at the Casino Royale. From check in to check out they were very rude. Especially ALLEN in registration. It was almost like he really didnt care! News Flash!! If you dont like people,find a new line of work. The rooms were o.k., but you can walk just a few steps and get great customer service,smiles,laughter for around the same price. I definetly would not even walk through that hotel on my next visit.!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For Craps it's the one place left on the strip with....”
Reviews.Author: mariygerman
Reviews.Content: three dollar front line bets and 100X true odds. But please note that's only true during weekdays now on the weekend it's $5 on the front line. they are also generous with the complementary drinks. if you're serious about maximizing your odds in craps this is the best place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “cheap tables and great dealers”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel65432123
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at Casino Royale, but played here quite a bit. There are $5 black jack. The dealers are really nice and willing to work with on learning the games. Great location on the stip and give you a sheet of coupons for signing up for their players card. Also, they have promotional slots outside that give free slot play and match play at tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great Odds in the Casino”
Reviews.Author: PlanoCW
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at the hotel but did gamble at the casino. Older style casino with smaller minimum bets than most other casinos. Great odds on the craps tables! Make sure you understand the odds and how to bet before playing craps, there were so many people that didn’t get it and the dealer’s were constantly having to explain it to them (Bill’s Casino has lessons everyday at 10:30 am).

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasFunGuy
Reviews.Content: First time staying here on our recent trip to Las Vegas on June 9, through June 12. Gotta say I love this place. Drinks are cheap staff is awsome and very talkable, especially the Security and Slot Personnel. Rooms are small but as others have said they have apparently be re-modeled recently to include a nice flat panel HD TV, refrigerators, safes, and some really nice down comforters on the room's beds. Hotel is small but it's right on the strip so there is no walking to be concerned with. The pool in the back is small but it's fairly private and for the couple of times we went out there we were the only people in the area aside from the occasional Security Guard or Housekeeping worker. Very much enjoyed our stay and will 100% stay here on our next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best dealers in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mnd85871
Reviews.Content: We gamble here every time we come to Vegas the dealers are always friendly and accomidating and with the low table limits you can play for hours also Always have cheap drinks $1 beers and margaritas

Reviews.Title: “Grungy, dirty, old school Vegas, gotta love it.”
Reviews.Author: ciceroCalgary
Reviews.Content: Let's just say you don't stay here if you want the new Vegas, big building, big pool, luxury experience. This is Vegas on a budget, right smack dab in the heart of the action. Ok, we actually stayed here in March of 2009, but that option wasn't available and I'm trying to catch up with my reviews. Was supposed to be coming to Vegas to see the Monster Jam World Finals with my bro. Well, the dork took the word Jam literally and did that to me at the last minute. Was originally booked at the Trop next door but now that I was footing 100% of the bill and had a family vacation booked 26 hours after I arrived home from this one I was looking to save money. An online search found this hotel for something like $35.00 a night, we switched names on the airline ticket and off my wife and I went. To say we weren't expecting much would be an understatement, but we just figured we'd groove on the whole cheap and dirty aspect of the whole week, we were attending monster races after all, YEEHAA!!!! I'm not going to write a pros cons review here as if you find cons in a $35.00 a night hotel you are tripping on a totally different plane that we are. Here goes, checkin was in this little side room off of the Casino floor, the desk clerk was pleasant in a two/ three star kinda way, we received some coupons for relatively useless crap, like 2 millers for a dollar, just in case one dollar a miller was too high falutin' for your budget.....lol. Your card key gains you access to the hotel which is accessed through a fairly institutional looking glass door, again off the casino floor. The first thing we noticed was fairly grubby hallways, narrow, old, shabby carpet, then we opened our room door and were blown away, they have renovated. You go from this nasty two star roach motel hallway into what felt like an older niche' hotel room. Though this is the farthest thing from the Belaggio, it was a very nice clean trendy room. The bed was amazingly comfortable with nice fresh linens, flat screen TV,we loved it. In march the pool was closed but it was just an old school kidney pool anyway. So after we unpacked and did the obligatory bounce on the bed we headed out into the Casino for a couple of drinks to unwind. Casino Royale, can you think of a cooler name than that, has $1 Miller Beer and Daquiris, that's right, One Frikkin Dollar, and the fellow behind the bar was flying, great service, always a smile. A lot of Vegas is starting to get weird with cheapos like us, they are lucky to be getting $100.00 from us through gambling when we are there and for those like us they are starting weird one drink at a time policies, or beer by the glass only for free, so a buck for a cold bottle of beer, couldn't be better. Yes, they aren't building Vegas on our gambling that's for sure, If you want to be in the heart of things, this is it, literally. Look at a map, they could not be in a better location. We walked everywhere and were quite happy to come home to our comfortable little room at night. Chipoltles is right next door and we are drooling because we are heading back to Vegas this July, eat there, yummmmm. This is a no frills, cheap, in the heart of the action, dare I say, Boutique??? Hotel. Would I bring my kids here, hell no, but if you are looking to let loose on a budget it's a great little piece of old style Vegas. Would I stay here again, probably not, but that has nothing to do with the hotel itself, it's me, I'm a bit of a snob. But never say never. We went to Vegas, didn't spend a lot of cash, drank more Miller than any man has a right too and had a blast, what more can you ask for. Then was back two weeks later at our timeshare, very different vacation...lol.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang For The Buck”
Reviews.Author: songsinger1
Reviews.Content: We had heard some sorted things about he Casino Royale, but happy to report that none were true. Rooms were very clean, staff was very friendly and the price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest little hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kieszka1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday weekend and will definately stay here again! We couldn't have asked for a better location, especially for the great price. The Venetian is on one side, Harrahs on the other, and Mirage right across the street. It was nice not having to walk 1/2 hour just to drop something in the room. Their casino was by far our favorite. Loose slots, cheaper tables and who doesn't love $1 Michelob and margaritas?! I have been to Vegas 3 other times and have stayed at NYNY, Stratosphere, and Alladin (now gone). The Casino Royale is top of my list now. Tip: don't let the cabs "long haul" you, which apparently means taking the highway - you'll end up paying almost double. The only bad points we found were the employees weren't very friendly and the hallway smelled. The room was pretty nice, actually nicer than I expected. Very comfortable bed and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: binchy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Casino Royale was a good experience. We were aware that the rooms had recently been remodeled but we were surprised how nice the room actually was. All the furniture in the room is new and modern. The room was exceptionally clean and the beds were quite comfortable. This was our 10th trip to Las Vegas and we have stayed in more expensive Casinos/Hotels and this was one of the nicest room we stayed in. The Casino itself is old but you can't beat the rooms or the price.

Reviews.Title: “They had me; then they lost me”
Reviews.Author: adnilnosnhoj
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with Casino Royale through AAA and got a sweet deal. $44 per night. I asked for six nights. My bad- I didn't check the actual dates I booked however and I was scheduled to check out on Monday when I believed I was actually booked up til Tuesday. At $44 the room is fantastic; heck even at twice the price I'd say it was a great deal. Right on center the strip; clean, safe room with a frig and soft beds. Yes, the room is quite small, so is the bathroom and it was really aggravating when it cooled down outside they turned off the AC option for the room, but for the advantages it had I was very pleased with the property. That is until I learned they had me scheduled to leave a day earlier then I expected. That wasn't their fault nor their problem, BUT when I asked to stay an extra night, (knowing I'd pay a higher price,) I never imagined the rate was more than QUADRUPLE (that right -4Xs!) the cost I had paid for the five nights I booked through AAA! The front desk quoted me the price of $169.99 for on week night, telling me there was a convention in town and ALL hotels on the strip was at premium rates! Well, thank God for the internet and places like here where I can check and see what other hotels are charging. As it turned out, there were several hotels, (including the once right next door to Casino Royale) asking less than $50 for that night! $44 a night? Great deal! $169 a night? NOT! I'm a gambler and a very surreptitious one at that. This experience was enough for me to say never again for Casino Royale. Even tough I can't say anything bad about the property or the staff, I just don't want to ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old School Casino”
Reviews.Author: Gsrmode
Reviews.Content: I have been a frequent traveler to Las Vegas for a long time and until recently have I discovered this extraordinary old school casino on the strip..I definitely recommend this casino to anyone looking for great value at a great location. Highlights Great Location $1.00 Beer & Margaritas Affordable Hotel Rooms – Remodeled Rooms Tix 4 Tonight Ticket Booth Located On Premises Food Court Outback & Denny’s restaurants Cheap Table Games Free Garage Parking

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: hotcraps
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, I expected it to be a dump, but never expected the service to be this poor. The drink service was fine, but the attitude of the crap table supervisors was horrible. I actually complained to the pit bosses about the rudeness and they just ignored me. I usually let my feet do the talking by just leaving, but decided to at least let them know this time. Unbelievably they just did not care. Oh well, lots of places in this town to take your business too. Kudos to the cashier and waitress who admitted that the crap table supervisors couldnt even spell customer service. They were equally amazed that these guys just dont get it.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Stay but great place to gamble!”
Reviews.Author: cksdcalgary
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at Casino Royale but given all the time I spent in the casino, I should of. If you are a beginner card player, this is the place for you! First off, they actually have $3-$5 tables. Secondly, the staff is excellent. From Monique who is hilarious to Linda who recently taught me to play 3 card poker they are so very friendly and make you feel very comfortable. Its the best place on the strip for a bargain as well. You can get a Michlobe for $1.00....the same beer is $7.00 at the Venetian. They also have $1.00 Margaritas. its a clean, comfortable and friendly casino!

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay here but wished we had! Spent a lot of time here.”
Reviews.Author: beanigrl
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas 11/29 to 12/2/10. We spent alot of time here at The Casino Royale. The staff that we had the pleasure of meeting were GREAT! Bartendar George was AWESOME! Made us feel as if we were in our neighborhood bar. The gift shop is amazing, great prices. $1 beers and Margaritas- can't beat it! At our hotel a Captain/coke was $10 here $3. Amazing place absolutely love it. Next trip to Vegas we are definitely going to look into staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Casino Royale comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: sj7
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean and comfortable place for a reasonable price, with a great location and casino, then here it is! The rooms are smaller than we were used to but still enough room for us! Everything was clean, bed comfortable, bathtub did not drain well the second day but we were leaving so not a problem, the only issue is the noise from the parking lot, we got woke up alot, mostly by service vehicles not customers!! We knew there was noice but thought the fan would buffer some of it but the fan was quieter than the normal fan so did not sleep too well, bed was comfortable, they were very accomodating, we got the king bed we requested on the top floor, that was great, staff friendly, checked in earlier so they stored our bags and said come back at 1:00 and our room was ready by 1:00. I would definitely stay there again if not for the interupted sleep, I do need my sleep so felt sick the 2 day as not enough of it for me!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bill31308
Reviews.Content: Pros- The price was right $79 a night Sat. and Sun.,the room was clean, had a refrigerator, awesome location on Strip near Ceasar's Palace where we attended a wedding, cheap food to eat at food court, $1 Michelobe's and margharita's at the bar. Cons- The hotel garage and parking lot really stank, the casino had a loudspeaker blaring outside on the sidewalk that I could hear plain as day at 8:30 in the morning when I woke up "GET YOUR CASINO ROYALE $50 FREE SLOT PLAY BLA BLA BLA BLA BLA BLA BLA" It was totally annoying and I could not get back to sleep. I turned the TV on and drowned it out. Overall I thought it was OK. I'd stay there again, maybe.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dave12933
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on oct 13 I had stayed here for many years but haven't stayed in 5 years . First when I signed up for there players club years I was guarentee life points. That was a big thing with them well I had 300.00 in points I go to use them they were gone They changed there rules. They give a coupon to play I went to a hot shot slot and got the bonus needed for there extra credits. I flaged down a slot person he says let me see you have to be a lawyer to read these. He says your on the wrong machine. I asked where the real slot was he didn't know.Room was ok same as before until I left checked out and forgot my phone charger when I got to my next hotel I called them up. Got no where had to wait 24 hrs no one would go up to the room to check, 24 hrs later I got told it wasn't in my room I went down there and asked to see where I left guess what it was there. I thought the service was just terrable and will never stay here again. Beware of there coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay at hotel but gambled here ALOT”
Reviews.Author: CMunster80
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this place is really a hole in the wall, I think even though you walk by it you don't even notice it or you assume it is part of one of the other casinos around it. I didn't stay here but I wanted to review the casino because I played here ALOT. Probably 40% of my stay I gambled here even though I stayed in Bally's. The atmosphere of this place is exactly as I described it is a hole in the wall, lights are not as bright as other places and it is kinda smokey and maybe even needs to do some upgrades to the casino floor. They do have a nice food court with a fair variety but don't expect anything spectacular. Now my gaming experience was AMAZING here despite its low key old school feeling. I was very inexperienced on the table when I went to vegas and I had chosen craps as my game to play. The dealers were very helpful and will give you tips that will help you keep playing as long as possible. I already had a strategy in mind from playing online and they helped me execute it to a T. The people that visit this place know what they are looking for as well. 3 dollar craps tables with 20x odds, you will find that NOWHERE else on the strip. Blackjack ran 5 dollars as well and were pretty freindly dealers. Only problem I did see was that their were way to few tables and they could get crowded, but the people who play here are what makes the games fun. Another thing I was not expecting from this place was the good looking cocktail waitresses, don't get me wrong their were a few that weren't that great but a majority were pretty nice on the eyes. So friendly dealers, low mins, low key but fun atmosphere if that is what you are looking for this is the place. I think it is a must if you are playing the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Royale”
Reviews.Author: cop0251
Reviews.Content: First let me say that last years trip to Vegas was my first, we had a great time and immediately planned this trip. Oct 1-5th. Last year we stayed at Harrahs Las Vegas and enjoyed it, my only complaint was the distance from our room to the casino floor and sportsbook. We ended up playing mostly at the Casino Royale which was next door, so this year we decided to take a chance and book our room at the Royale. The Royale was great, clean room and easy access directly to the casino floor and the strip. If you are looking for a great hotel in the best location on the strip, next door to Harrahs and Carnival Court, The Venetian, across the street from Mirage and Caesars. The Royale can not be beaten for price and location. They have a Mcdonalds next door, Outback steakhouse on the second floor and Ben and Jerrys ice cream shop all in the Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever, What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Darrelinaj
Reviews.Content: We visited on Aug 28 & 29, found that the casino staff was rude, crude and was trying to get sexual favors from women in return for players club benefits AFTER midnight. The restrooms were dirty at midnight and out of supplies and was still that way at 3 AM, and so close to the food court, found employees could not even use the restrooms and wash their hands after. I took my players club card and my wife's and turned them in to the club attendant and made a complaint, did no good, we have been staying there and gambling for a few years, we have found that the service and the staff have been going down the tubes for awhile. The health department and the LVPD / NGC really need to put undercover agents in place on the weekends to either clean up the place or close it down, also found that the Outback Steakhouse and the Denny's was just as bad for service, food and staff. We will never be back, and I would not even let my dogs eat or drink ANYTHING form there, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Nestled Between Big Resorts”
Reviews.Author: kswalston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay for those on a budget. The rooms were updated a couple of years ago. Although the rooms are small they are clean and include standard amenities of a safe, small refrigerator and coffee maker. The front desk staff has always been friendly and helpful when checking in and out. Maria is usually working when I check in/out and she does a great job! The casino is small and you definitely won't loose anyone in your party for long. Slot machine denominations range from a penny to $5 when I was there. The table games offer low mininums and the craps tables are always busy. You never have to wait for a cocktail server to bring you a drink while you are playing slots/tables. They do a good job and work hard. The bar prices are fantastic. $1 Michelob and very inexpensive mixed drinks. The total for 1 Michelob bottle, 1 Bud Light bottle and 1 Jack & Coke was $3.75! Darryl, Jim, John and the rest of the gang are great bartenders. Expansion and remodeling took place over the past two years and the food court was moved to the back of the casino and now includes a hot dog place, Cinnabon, Noble Romans and Subway. Outback is still located upstairs close to the entrance next to Ben and Jerrys. This casino is worth a visit. Hoepfully you will find the place as inviting and friendly as I did.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: bjhilly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Casino Royale before and enjoyed it. The last stay they had renovated all the rooms and they were beautiful! I've never had a problem with the staff there. We are traveling back in October and plan on staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good as Usual”
Reviews.Author: myrtlebeachtravelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Las Vegas for the 4th of July week staying at the Casino Royale. As usual our room was great. The rooms are very clean and the added bonus of the refrigerator and safe was a big plus. It is not a a big resort with all of the amenities that a lot of people look for in Vegas but if you want a nice clean safe room right in the middle of the strip you can't go wrong. Having the pool to ourselves for most of the week was fun as we like to bring our own drinks and music with us and there were no issues. If you want shade there is some to be had. We have stayed here many times and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajd_19
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great as I didn't stay there but went to the hotel each day. The service was great, the location is awesome, cheap drinks, and good food. It isn't a 5 star hotel but always had outstanding service. The drinks are very cheap and it's a great small casino and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: ALR77
Reviews.Content: Pros On the Strip, near The Venetian. Good prices. Cons Staff, security, service. Vegas have many others valuable options to stay, only choose it if you have a Congress or Convention in the Venetian and you dont want to spend much money.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be worth the money and location, but not anymore.”
Reviews.Author: unhappy024
Reviews.Content: We've been to this hotel several times, but after this last weekend will not return. The front desk staff was unfriendly when we checked in or out. They were not pleasant on the phone when we called to advise them that the elevator didn't work and when we called at the end of the day for status, they didn't even know the elevator was out of service. The rooms are quite nice. Both the room and the halls are very clean and I really like the upscale appearance. The downsides were- After the first day, the air conditioning quit working. Every night around 3 am a huge truck woke me; I think it was a garbage truck. The soda machine in the hall dispensed only warm sodas. The shower was good for the first person, but ran cold water for the second. There was a nice, big screen TV in our room, but it didn't work. The location and the rates are the reason we have stayed there. We have recommended Casino Royale to our friends and family over the years; however, we won't be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas 2010”
Reviews.Author: myrtlebeachtravelers
Reviews.Content: Casino Royale has some of the nicest people we have ever come across in/on a vacation. Having beeen here many times before we knew what to expect and we were not disappointed. Rooms are very clean and well kept during our stay. The refrigerator is a huge bonus. Mom took full avantage of the coffee maker in the room throughout the day. The location can not be beat and if you are on a budget many low cost food options are within a short walking distance. Great central location for a lot of fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: shiroubi
Reviews.Content: Rooms at the hotel had been remodeled so I thought I'd give this establishment a try. Room was equipped with a mini-fridge and coffee-maker. The room was of moderate size with a king-sized bed. The bed was pretty soft and I loved the throw on top of the bedding! My boyfriend claimed it was as good as the Bellagio, if not, then better. I thought Casino Royale offered a good value for the price. I believe we paid less than $150 for three nights. I would describe our room quality to be like an upscale Motel 6, and I was pleasantly surprised with the overall look of our room. The only cons with the room was that our bathroom was pretty small and the walls were paper thin. I kept on hearing heavy footsteps upstairs and people bustling about outside our room. If you're a light sleeper, then this hotel may not be good for you. I had no problems. Also, the hotels staff were very friendly and accommodating--always a plus. I would definitely stay here again. Affordable rooming and gaming = good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: maddiescoots
Reviews.Content: The Casino Royale is a very no frill hotel. Not that makes it a bad place to stay. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip. I found it very easy to walk to other locations with great ease. The room was very spacious and looked as if it had been recently updated. The complimentary in room safe and dry bar with coffeemaker was a great amenity with no additional costs. The bathroom was spacious and stocked with plenty of pluses and plenty of towels. Upon check-in I encounterd a very friendly host. Considering it was late in the evening he was very quick and thoughtful. He even mentioned nearby hotels that offered free shuttles to other locations and reminded me that the hotel offered a luggage holding area if my check out and flight did not correlate. Now, there were a few negatives. The walls seemed a bit thin. I could hear people coming and going in the hall and could hear the tv in the room next to me. My room was located next to the outdoor courtyard area that sits between Casino Royale and Harrahs and there was some type of loudspeaker going on and on. I went to Vegas to run the marathon so I spent more time in the room then a usual, so these things were probably were more noticeable. After checking in I went down to the Casino to sign up for the "fun book" they offer. The hostess was rather curt and did not seem happy. Since it seemed I was bothering her as she was processing the request, I questioned why they didn't just offer the book when I checked in, she never acknowledged I even asked her a question. Overall the Casino Royale is a very nice hotel. The offer a great location and a nice room, other hotels in Las Vegas may be nicer and offer more amenities but you will pay for that. If rooms are available I would definitely make the Casino Royale my choice hotel while visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and Touring”
Reviews.Author: rags158
Reviews.Content: Cool place right on the strip its a bit small but what do you want for such a cheap hotle in the middle of everything...staff are great also.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal ever!”
Reviews.Author: Raidergurl1787
Reviews.Content: The hotel allowed us to check in by 1 pm, the rooms were neat and tighty, all drinks in the bar were only $1! And they had a Ben and Jerry's! I mean this hotel is the best, its right across street from Mirage, and next to Venetian! We were right in the center of everything and their service was the best. They are going thru some remodeling and their is no valet so you have to park in car garage in back of hotel but we didn't really care much about that. If your on budget, this is definitely a great place to be! I will definitely be going back there cause 70 bucks a night was the best. It didn't have the best of pools, but overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value, Exactly As Expected.”
Reviews.Author: mrsstewart09
Reviews.Content: Before our first trip my husband and I really did our research before booking a hotel room. We're on a budget, and being we stayed two nights during the week we got a good deal on our room at $55 a night. We value location over having lots of "extras" because honestly, how long are you in your room in Vegas anyway? Pros: Excellent location! Centrally located on the strip, the Venetian and Harrah's are right next door and the Mirage is across the street. We could easily access everything located in the center of the strip. We drove to Vegas so we had our car with us, and the parking structure was no fuss, no muss and easily accessible. Rooms were just as pictured on the website, and actually a bit bigger than I expected. The bed was quite comfortable and we had excellent water pressure in the shower. There is an Outback Steakhouse, Denny's, Subway, and Noble Roman Pizza located here. We ate at the Denny's twice for the sake of price and convenience, and each meal was great! The casino bar offers $1 margarita's and $1 Michelob Light and Michelob Original Lager. Cons: Figuring out where the front desk for check-in was a bit confusing upon our arrival. You have to enter through the rear of the building due to construction, and walk through the casino to check in. We read a few reviews which people complained about this same problem, and it was still a bit confusing for us once we got inside. Because of construction there is noise coming from outside, and we had a view of it. The walls are also paper thin. We could hear everything going on in the hallway, and at times we felt like our window was open because we could hear the construction so well. But really, coming to Vegas to get a great nights rest? C'mon...I forgot to pack my toothbrush, so we called down to the front desk to see if they had those cheap-o toothbrushes, but they didn't so that was kind of an inconvenience. The high-speed internet access is not in the room, it's downstairs in their lobby area. The margarita's served at the casino bar for $1 didn't have much tequila in them. It may seem very minor, but I thought our hallway smelled "funky." Luckily the smell didn't carry over into our room! Overall, the hotel is a good value and you can't beat the location. That said, I personally would not pay $100 a night to stay here, because there are just too many "little" things that are not offered here that you might expect (like the front desk to carry some toothbrushes) from a hotel. The staff members we encountered were friendly, but don't expect to be treated like royalty here. Great budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise - Clean & Comfortable for a "Budget" Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: tucsonnative
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money if you want to stay on the strip but have a lot more money in your pocket to gamble with. The rooms have been recently remodeled - very clean and with comfortable bed/linens and flat screen TV. While the room / rate exceeded my expectations, there were a few downsides to this hotel. First - if you will have a vehicle, be prepared to experience a small challenge getting into/out of the hotel's parking facility. It has direct access onto the strip (good), but without any type of pedestrian traffic control (bad). This means you will have to wait unitl one or two or fifty kind souls stop walking to let your car pass. On the other hand, if you don't have a vehicle - you can't beat the convenience or the price! Second - most of the rooms appear to face into the service areas for Casino Royale and Harrah's. Our "view" was of Harrah's employees smoke/break area and vendor delivery areas. Heard various delivery trucks in and out throughout the night. But - how often are you in your room in Vegas, anyways? Third - the windows have very nice plantation shutters - look really nice, but do not block out the sun like the traditional black-out window coverings you find in most Vegas hotels. Overall, a pleasant "budget" stay on the strip this time around, but will probably not return based simply on vehicle access - but if you are going the shuttle/cab/walking route, you can't beat the value and convenience of staying on the strip for under $75/night!

Reviews.Title: “For it's location you can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: ttab
Reviews.Content: With some bad reviews, major renos going on and a small gambling area that we thought would be really smokey, we really expected the worse, but were totally wrong! With less than 2 days in Vegas and lugging 2 small children, we opted to stay in smaller hotel over the gigantic ones. Looked everywhere and wanted to stay on the strip but the prices for 3-5 star hotels were in the 3 digit range so for $69 USD a night for the end of June weekend at the Casino Royale, this place was a steal!! Upon arriving at the parking lot in the back, the place looked less than appealing because of the renos but the front clerk said it would be done by August. From the parking lot to the front desk, it was a short walk, the two front clerks were really nice, no wait at 11pm. Got our room key and walked passed the gambling area which did not reek of cigarettes. I mean there were cigarette smells here and there but you wouldn't be inhaling anymore than walking behind someone who was smoking outside on the strip. There's a huge locked sliding glass door that separates the hotel rooms from the casino and everything else which was great and it's located across from the Ben & Jerry's ice cream store and one of the main entrances that leads you outside, another happy surprise! They gave us room 318 and it was nicely renovated, it looks as they advertised on their website. Beds were high and comfy, enough space for two small kids to run around and there was even a huge flat screen tv to compliment the room decor. This time maid service listened to us when we asked them not to come in our room to clean up....lol. Lots of hot water for shower, cold a/c works fine, small fridge was handy but no microwave for fast convenient heating drinks/food. There is a small coffee maker that we used to warm my kid's milk, which was fine. Night sleep was good, no noise from outside at all. Only negative thing I wish they had was a nice pool but for the weekend price and prime location, you really can't go wrong with this little gem. Great stay and I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Mid Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: mcstix
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here in May, 2009, and will again later this month (July.) Front desk is right off the strip basically, as is the entrance to the hotel rooms. Very convenient. There is NO valet parking, but the lot is pretty close to the hotel. Not a long walk from most areas of the garage to the front desk. The "good" spaces outside the garage next to the casino are less than a minute's walk to the front desk. This place does not claim to be a resort (it's certainly not) but it is located NEAR some nice resorts. The rooms are basic, but clean as far as I could see. No bugs, blood, or guts that I could find, and this place is pretty old. Many, including the one I stayed in, have been recently remodeled though, and so really didn't look bad at all. I'd say the room I was in was better than a Motel 6 for instance. No floor to ceiling windows or anything fancy, but it was clean and functional. The noise from LVB was only slightly annoying, and earplugs took care of that. I slept real good. No loud parties in the hall, and they have security cameras too I believe. The "hotel" part of the casino actually runs east from the strip, and has four floors and 152 rooms; while the casino itself parallels the strip for the most part. The whole place is kind of like an "L" shape. Some of the rooms at the "crux" of the L are pretty much right off the strip actually, and it took me about 15 seconds to get from my room to Las Vegas Blvd from mine. I could also walk into Harrah's and be at their blackjack "Party Pit" in about 30 seconds...probably quicker than anyone STAYING at Harrah's. The gym next door at Harrah's is also only about a two or three minute walk from Casino Royale. I had NO problems with the front desk, and they seemed very accommodating to me, though I've read complaints from others. Maybe I was just lucky, or it was a weekday check in I don't know. At any rate, I'm going to be staying there AGAIN later this month. They COMPED me a room for three nights, and I didn't really think I'd get comped at my level of play. This is a BIG PLUS for me as a gambler. Other casinos I wouldn't have even earned a lousy (and it probably would have been lousy!) buffet! Granted the rooms here are always inexpensive, but I liked that they thought enough of my play to actually comp me a room. Heck, they only have 152 rooms! Maid service was good. I had no complaints. They also have free Internet on the first floor for guests. I felt pretty secure in the hotel; and the rooms have a safe as well as a fridge and I think maybe even a microwave (can't remember.) T.V. worked okay but not too many channels. I wouldn't say the reception (cable?) was all that great either. But it did the job for watching the local news at night, which is about all I used it for. There IS construction going on still I believe, so I'd ask for an even-numbered room if they have one. That would be on the Harrah's side of the building. I'd also try to get as close to LVB as possible or else you may hear them crashing bottles into the trash cans after the bars empty them from Harrah's next door. This is Harrah's noise, so don't blame the Royale for this at least. There is a Subway sandwich place on site, as well as a Denny's. Next door (30 seconds from my room) is a McDonald's; and below that is a food court with Chinese and Mexican "mall food." Outback Restaurant (the busiest in the WORLD I was told) is upstairs and they will comp you if you gamble enough. It was good and I ate lunch there several times. You can watch the peeps walk by from there as well as the Denny's. I eat this stuff at home, and think most of the Vegas fancy restaurants are not worth the money unless you're trying to impress your girl. You can be in the Mirage Casino in less than three minutes from the front of Casino Royale. Heck, what can I say? I like this place! The plusses (location, price, convenience, room safe, fridge etc.) far outweigh the minuses in my opinion. The minuses would be the smoke in the casino (and I SMOKE!) The casino is pretty well-worn as well, and yes SOME of the dealers are downright indifferent or even rude at times. They probably don't get paid much. I DID have a great experience at their craps tables though. Best odds on the strip from what I can see, and I found ALL the craps guys and gals to be nice and not rude at all. There was one guy there actually who should have been working in a better place he was so good. He knew what I was going to do before I did, and kept track of my bets real well! Of course I was tipping the boys some too, which I'm sure got their attention, but they were nice to everyone from what I could see. Slots were not that loose in my opinion. I'd try El Cortez downtown Vegas for loose slots. It's a dump, too, but does have loose slots. That's it!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Dealers, No CW anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: ILPenny
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here but was at the casino next door. I wandered into the Casino Royale and decided to play Let It Ride. It was approximately 1:00 in the afternoon on a Saturday. I was the only one at the table and the dealer acted like he'd rather watch the TV over the bar area than deal cards to me. He didn't talk and kept stopping the game to watch TV. I also looked everywhere for a cocktail waitress and never found one. Because of this experience I will never consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Budget Option - right on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: balis_magic
Reviews.Content: Wow! what a find! This little hotel was great right in the middle of the strip. We were travelling at Xmas time and it was really expensive everywhere else but this hotel was fabulous. In a small casino next to McDonalds on the strip. The rooms were clean and spacious and had two queen beds. i would stay here again in a heartbeat as a cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: “Casino Royale Is The Worst Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: emartinez1302
Reviews.Content: We had such a bad time there. First when we got there we the room smelled like smoke. We ignored it and thought we wouldnt be in the hotel anyway, left a window open and enjoyed vegas. That was the first the second night we were there, our entire cieling where the front door in our room is, that entire area was leaking water all of our clothes and electronics was soaked. Turns out that the guy above us fell asleep in his tub and left the water running. To this day the management said that they are not responsible and told us tough luck. The management and staff are horrible and do not take care of their guests!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: testerosa
Reviews.Content: stayed here in feb.09 4 days,clean room and comfortable bed,wide screen tv refrigerator.everything you need,small smokey casino but ok,cannot beat the location for the money,casino royale please dont change.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: darryl370
Reviews.Content: I'm rating this based on the fact that it was a fantastic deal, very clean, and in a great location. Our room was very clean - and housekeeping did a great job cleaning it every morning. They are also recently remodeled and it's perfect for a weekend getaway for guys or gals. I wouldn't recommend it for a "romantic getaway" but it's great for a bunch of friends on the party! A bunch of my friends were in Vegas for a long weekend. They are a bunch of drunk idiots so they didn't need anything elegant - just a place to crash. This worked out great because Casino Royale is in such a great location. It's VERY easy to get in and out of the hotel (seconds from the main door to the street). They also have cheap food for late at night like Roman Noble's Pizza and Subway. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. My only advice is to ask for an ODD numbered room. We had room 328 and it faced Harrah's side alley. There were a bunch of casino workers smashing glass in the dumpster each night (beer bottles). The ODD numbered rooms face their parking lot, which would be much quieter. I didn't complain because the noise was coming from Harrah's and was beyond the control of the Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Viva The Casino Royale”
Reviews.Author: JuneandChris
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 12 night stay at The Casino Royale and can thoroughly recommend it. The location is ace, right in the middle of the strip, rooms were very comfortable and clean and the beds were adorable. Excellent maid service each day. No noise at night in the hotel section so we managed to sleep soundly. The swimming pool is an ample size and was still open when we were there. The staff were very friendly. IWe/d definately stay there again. June and Chris from scotland

Reviews.Title: “Most Underrated in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMotoFamily
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, and centrally located on the strip, I love this place! Sure, this is not one of the "major players" in Vegas, but if you are looking for a clean place, with great location, this is the place to be. Not huge, it does not take one 20+ minutes to get from room to street. It took us less than 30 seconds! The rooms are clean and, as stated, recently renovated. One great feature: there are safes in the room that work excellently. I have to admit, maid service was slow. But when they did show, they did a great job. Cheap eats are all around this place. Located next to Harrah's, you can go there to eat at one of the many places there. Otherwise, it is directly next door to both McD's and Dennys. I don't gamble, but do drink and the .99 cent margaritas in the casino were awesome any time of day or night! There are stands and bars with drink specials not far from Casino Royale's doors, making it a great location for the person who does not wish to spend a fortune on alcohol, but wishes to purchase a lot of alcohol! Again, I don't gamble, but per other reviews and guide books know that Casino Royal offers some of the best odds on the strip. However, if you are looking to game late at night into the morning with Vegas' elite, don't head to Casino Royale. Past one A.M., the clientele is a tad seedy. But it is so close to the Venetian, Harrahs, among others. I read reviews that Casino Royale is of the smokiest. Well, they don't offer smoking rooms, or smoking in hall ways, so that is a plus. I must be used to run down little pubs at home, because I did not think even the casino was all that smokey. It is easy to catch the Deuce near Casino Royale. Either Harrahs or Imperial Palace has a monorail station, so that is near too, but I did not catch that at all. IP has a close by taxi hub, so that was handy. Overall, this is such a great place, that with the recent remodeling, I am sure that next time I go prices will not be as affordable...$313 for Thurs-Sun. Not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: k8gret
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap and in the BEST location! It is located right next to Harrah and across the street from the Mirage among many of the other hotels that are walking distance....even in high heels! There is a 24 hour McDonalds within about 10 feet as well as some other affordable restaurants with great hours. The hallways of the actual hotel rooms are a little smelly and old looking but the room is decent. There is a nice sized mini-fridge right in the room and the beds are GREAT! I heard that they just refurbished the rooms and I was definitely happy with my booking. My next trip to Vegas will definitely be booked at the Casino Royale!!! PS - The casino itself offers $1.00 Michelob and Michelob Light as well as $1.00 margaritas....great way to pre-party without going far from your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Back in Time....”
Reviews.Author: Live4NowSouthFlorida
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent visitor to Las Vegas and having stayed at the "best of the best." I have to say that staying at Casino Royale is a "step back in time." A time when courtesy, affordability, pride, and cleanliness are an everyday commodity. I love the quick ease in which the hotel is accessed. No struggles for elevators and 20plus floors. The quaint facility has a demeanor of yesteryear, with the gaming of today. New mattresses and bedding and flooring were an even greater welcome than I expected this past trip. How many of the "glitzy" hotels actually give you a refrigerator you can use?? This one does. Perhaps it doesn't boast a celebrity, or offer buffets, but you will find this a very pleasant environment while you are in Las Vegas. If you do choose to play, then use your comps at Outback Steakhouse which is located upstairs, or the Subway, or Pizza bar. I give this hotel a thumbs up for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: ladymoscow
Reviews.Content: Cool place. Perfect location on the strip. Clean big rooms, no frills, but who cares your never in there in Vegas. No pool, but just use one of the other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, Pit Bosses Negative”
Reviews.Author: craps24-7
Reviews.Content: Hotel room in line with $69 pricing; friendly, efficient housekeeper; efficient, helpful front desk personnel; dealers at table games mostly good... HOWEVER, playing at a craps table one night, a pit boss was extremely loud and rude to a shooter. The shooter remained calm and mature and complied with the instructions by the pit boss on the throwing of the dice. But at the end of the fantastic roll, the pit boss continued loud admonishment of the shooter and banned the guest from shooting the dice again. Another pit boss then literally threw the shooter’s player card toward him onto the table. A "big boss" was in the pit and said nothing to the employees about their unprofessional actions. One young lady even told the pit boss this was her first time at craps and that when she threw the dice please don’t yell at her like that. The inappropriate communication behavior by the pit boss drove some of us committed craps players away. We found $3 craps tables downtown with especially great people and service at Binion's - they were polite, customer caring, friendly - even when directing guests on rules of dice throwing. We played over 40 hours of craps at Binion’s with excellent service, fun atmosphere and even some winnings. One Casino Royale dealer told me that management kept up with table games' profits and losses throughout the day and night and pressured pit bosses when tables were losing to the house. Maybe that pit boss was trying to interrupt the shooter's great run at that moment - the shooter still made all of us a lot of money quickly. No more Casino Royale for us.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Casino Royale.”
Reviews.Author: motherr
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? We've stayed at Casino Royale two to three times a year for the past 3 years. We've tried the bigger hotel/casinos and found Casino Royale to be a better value and more convenient. Its a small, fun casino, great service, friendly staff, comfortable rooms. We liked the card access security feature. If your ego demands a fancy resort, you should book elsewhere. If you are looking for fun at a reasonable price, then stay at Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: kc2gvx
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel is Non-Smoking effective March 1st, so this is excellent news for some, and heartbreaking for others. I got 2 comp nights, but rates are always cheap during the week, and about $100 cheaper on weekends than the "big guys." The beds were more comfortable than the room I had at Harrah's the previous nights. AC worked well, and the windows opened, which is a huge plus for me, I enjoy fresh air. Shower pressure was decent, and bathroom was clean. In room has a coffee pot, refrigerator, and safe. Television has 14 channels, and no video check out. Also, my main complaint is NO internet access, even for a fee. You need to swipe your room key just to get into the building, I see this as a hassle, others might enjoy the extra security. To deal with the traffic, learn the back driveway into the garage. Just follow signs for Harrah's valet, but proceed straight under the large Harrah's globe sign that goes across that access road.

Reviews.Title: “An unusual package in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RVonthego
Reviews.Content: We were headed to Las Vegas for a spring break weekend and picked a time when city-wide rates were off the charts. Stumbled on a deal for the Casino Royale property located in the shadow of the Venetian and across the street from the Mirage. A small hotel with no public space we had trouble finding where to check-in. Very nervous when we saw construction dumpsters in the parking lot. fortunately our room was already renovated. Comfortable room in a well-worn property. In-room mini-fridge, cable TV, nice bedding and a decent bathroom. There is a Ben & Jerry's, Denny's and Outback Steakhouse in the property. Small casino without a lot of frills. The best part is the location. convenient parking and a very short walk to most of the major casinos. Literally a few hundred feet from the entrance to the Venetian. If you want to be on the infamous strip and you don't require a high level of amenities, then this property will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Casino Royale is Great”
Reviews.Author: unmlobos
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of 8 guys (age 25-45) to go to the Mountain West Tournament. All four rooms were recently renovated. New carpet, new beige paint, new bedding (VERY SOFT!). hotel is small but nicer than we thought it would be. It is a budget hotel but the location can not be beat. The casino bar hosts $1 and $1.50 beers with very friendly bartenders. The elevator is very small and old, we only used it when we had luggage. Overall a wonderful stay. Tip - walk to Harrahs through the parking garage to catch taxis. When I come to Vegas with my wife we will stay at the Bellagio or Wynn, but when we come out for a guys weekend definately Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: McGuire333
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay on the strip. Lots of action and super fun. The hotel is clean and the service is great! We will be back. Perfect for the budget and also felt very safe. We have not been to Vegas in 16 years and will definately we go back to this hotel. YOU WONT BE SORRY! Good luck and VIVA LAS VEGAS!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2Utah
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Casino Royale was fine. The location and price can't be beat. We even had a fridge in our room. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - LOCATION is awesome though”
Reviews.Author: SLC80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I compromised - we stayed here for 4 nights and then went to the Venetian for 4 nights. This place actually was exactly what I read and expected. Run of the mill cheap hotel in a SUPERB location. Yes it's used and kind of dirty, but the price cannot be beat. $59-$79 a night. It looks like any room that price nearly anywhere in the U.S. **Warning - YES - there were prostitutes about (by the security door to get in the hotel area) and they are not modest. NOT a family hotel. Staff was courteous, casino small but kept well, room was cleaned as well as could be. NOTE - each time I called for something they were there within minutes (extra pillows, towels, etc.). I even called about our T.V. not working and the guy fixed it within 20 minutes. Our window looked out over their pool - not heated, not clean in December, just an F.Y.I. We could also see the Venetian towering above AND heard that huge BONG BONG each morning, on the hour, from the Venetian's Bell Tower (see the pictures I've included here). So be warned. BUT - this hotel is what I read and I was prepared. Go there with these things in mind and you're good to go. Again, you cannot beat the price or location. Personally, I would probably not stay there again - I'd buck up the extra $40-$50 a night and stay a few doors down at the Flamingo or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lotravel
Reviews.Content: It started out really bad, I had asked for an upper floor smoking. When I enter the bathroom the tub had this black gunk by the drain. I walked into the sleep area to use the phone and the bed was not made, it was stripped of sheets, everything. I called and went back to the main desk. I did not get a smoking room but the room the desk person gave me was very nice! He was sweet, told me I could move to a smoking room the next day but I told him I will stay in the one he gave me, the room was great. If you have to smoke there are areas on the same floor that have a bench and a big ash can. The cocktail waitresses are not as nice as they used to be. I think I saw their supervisor giving one of them hell , she was sweet to me; not a great thing to do right in front of patrons. I wouldn't be happy working there either if that's how she treats staff. The waitresses I have met in the past two years have been really nice - too bad they left Casino Royale. Great place to stay. I felt safe, it is clean and best of all, right in the middle of the strip. I always stay here and I visit Vegas at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Elvis45
Reviews.Content: First of all let me advise if you want luxury and great strip views, breakfast in bed and expensive room service, don't stay here!
